name: Chronicle
description: This app enables the end-user to search, analyze, and ingest the enterprise security data stored in the Chronicle using investigative, reputation, and ingestion actions

key_json.description: Contents Of Service Account JSON File

malicious_category.description: Malicious Categories for Reputation (JSON formatted list)

malicious_severity.description: Malicious Severity for Reputation (JSON formatted list)

malicious_str_confidence_score.description: Malicious Str Confidence Score for Reputation (JSON formatted list)

malicious_int_confidence_score.description: Malicious Int Score Range for Reputation (Use this format 'min_score,max_score')

suspicious_category.description: Suspicious Categories for Reputation (JSON formatted list)

suspicious_severity.description: Suspicious Severity for Reputation (JSON formatted list)

suspicious_str_confidence_score.description: Suspicious Str Confidence Score for Reputation (JSON formatted list)

suspicious_int_confidence_score.description: Suspicious Int Confidence Score Range for Reputation (Use this format 'min_score,max_score')

run_mode.description: Ingestion Run Mode for ON POLL

backdate_time.description: Backdate Start Time in minutes (for scheduled polling)

rule_ids.description: Comma-separated Rule ID(s) (with or without versionId) for fetching the detections

fetch_live_rules.description: Fetch all live rules created in the Detection Engine

run_automation.description: Flag to Trigger Active Playbooks upon Completion of the Ingestion Action

alerts_severity.description: Alert Severity to Ingest Alerts (JSON formatted list) (If not given ingest all the alerts)

start_time_scheduled_poll.description: Start Time for Scheduled/Interval POLL (Use this format: '<digit><d/h/m/s>' or 'start_time')

time_range_poll_now.description: Time Range for POLL NOW (Use this format: 'start_time, end_time' or '<digit><d/h/m/s>' or 'start_time')

max_results_scheduled_poll.description: Max Results for Scheduled/Interval POLL (Page Size)

max_results_poll_now.description: Max Results for POLL NOW (Page Size)

max_artifacts.description: Max Allowed Artifacts in a Single Container

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Return any threat intelligence associated with the specified artifact

example_values: Drop site for logs or stolen credentials

actions.description: List all of the IoCs discovered within the enterprise within the specified time
actions.verbose: The action will fetch the list of all of the IoCs discovered within the enterprise within the specified time. If the user receives 'moreDataAvailable' as a true value in the action output datapaths, there might still be more IoCs within the user's Chronicle account. The user can narrow the time range and run the action again to ensure visibility into all possible IoCs. If the user doesn't provide any of the time-related action parameters, the action will perform a search for the last three days. If the user provides [Time Range] and other time-related action parameters, the priority will be given to the [Time Range] action parameter and the search will be performed according to its given value.

time_range.description: Specify the time range of the search (Use this format <digit><d/h/m/s> where d=Days, h=Hours, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

start_time.description: Specify the start time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of IoCs results to return. You can specify between 1 and 10,000. (Default is 10,000)

example_values: Drop site for logs or stolen credentials

actions.description: List all of the assets that accessed the specified artifact within the specified time
actions.verbose: If the user doesn't provide any of the time-related action parameters, the action will perform a search for the last three days. If the user provides [Time Range] and other time-related action parameters, the priority will be given to the [Time Range] action parameter and the search will be performed according to its given value.

time_range.description: Specify the time range of the search (Use this format <digit><d/h/m/s> where d=Days, h=Hours, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

start_time.description: Specify the start time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

end_time.description: Specify the end time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of assets to return. You can specify between 1 and 10,000. (Default is 10,000)

actions.description: List all of the events discovered within the enterprise on a particular device within the specified time
actions.verbose: If the user doesn't provide any of the time-related action parameters, the action will perform a search for the last three days. If the [Reference Time] action parameter is not given, the action will consider start time as reference time. And if the value is given for it, the value will be validated and used in the search request. If the user provides [Time Range] and other time-related action parameters, the priority will be given to the [Time Range] action parameter and the search will be performed according to its given value.

time_range.description: Specify the time range of the search (Use this format <digit><d/h/m/s> where d=Days, h=Hours, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

start_time.description: Specify the start time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

end_time.description: Specify the end time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

reference_time.description: Specify the time for the asset you are investigating (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of events results to return (Default is 10,000)

actions.description: Derive the reputation of the specified domain artifact (The reputation can be either of 'Malicious', 'Suspicious', and 'Unknown')
Derive the reputation of the specified destination IP address artifact (The reputation can be either of 'Malicious', 'Suspicious', and 'Unknown')

example_values: Drop site for logs or stolen credentials

actions.description: List all of the security alerts tracked within the enterprise on particular assets and|or users for the specified time
actions.verbose: The user can specify the [Alert Type] to fetch. If the user doesn't provide any of the time-related action parameters, the action will perform a search for the last three days. If the user provides [Time Range] and other time-related action parameters, the priority will be given to the [Time Range] action parameter and the search will be performed according to its given value.

time_range.description: Specify the time range of the search (Use this format <digit><d/h/m/s> where d=Days, h=Hours, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

start_time.description: Specify the start time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

end_time.description: Specify the end time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return. You can specify between 1 and 100,000. (Default is 10,000)

alert_type.description: Specify the type of alerts to fetch

example_values: Total assets with alerts: 7, Total alerts: 728

actions.description: List the latest versions of the rules created in the Detection Engine within the enterprise
actions.verbose: If the user doesn't provide any value in the [Limit] action parameter, then the action will fetch 1000 rules (or less, if there are lesser rules created in the Detection Engine within the enterprise).

limit.description: Specify the number of rules to return (Default is 1000)

example_values:
generic::invalid_argument: validating rule: invalid regex pattern: */../vpns/*: error parsing regexp: missing argument to repetition operator: `*`
line: 10 
column: 36-49

Detects known malicious service installs that only appear in cases of lateral movement, credential dumping and other suspicious activity  License: https://github.com/Neo23x0/sigma/blob/master/LICENSE.Detection.Rules.md.

rule malicious_service_installations {
	meta:
		author = ]"Test Author"
		description = "Detects known malicious service installs that only appear in cases of lateral movement, credential dumping and other suspicious activity  License: https://github.com/Neo23x0/sigma/blob/master/LICENSE.Detection.Rules.md."
		reference = "[]"
		version = "0.01"
		created = "2021-01-25"
        logsource = "windows"
        

	events:
($selection.metadata.product_log_id = "7045" and (($selection.target.process.command_line = "WCESERVICE" or $selection.target.process.command_line = "WCE SERVICE") or $selection.target.process.command_line = "\\PAExec" or $selection.target.process.command_line = "winexesvc.exe" or $selection.target.process.command_line = "\\DumpSvc.exe" or $selection.target.process.command_line = "mssecsvc2.0" or $selection.target.process.command_line = " net user " or ($selection.target.process.command_line = "pwdump" or $selection.target.process.command_line = "gsecdump" or $selection.target.process.command_line = "cachedump")))

	condition:
		$selection
}

actions.description: List all the detections for the specific versions of the given Rule ID(s)
actions.verbose: The comma-separated [Rule ID(s)] can be provided with or without versionId appended to each Rule ID. If the user doesn't provide any of the time-related action parameters, the action will perform a search for the last three days. If the user provides [Time Range] and other time-related action parameters, the priority will be given to the [Time Range] action parameter and the search will be performed according to its given value.

rule_ids.description: Comma-separated Rule ID(s) (with or without versionId)

alert_state.description: Alert State to filter the detections

time_range.description: Specify the time range of the search (Use this format <digit><d/h/m/s> where d=Days, h=Hours, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

start_time.description: Specify the start time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

end_time.description: Specify the end time of the search (Use this format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ where y=Year, M=Month, d=Day, H=Hour, m=Minutes, s=Seconds)

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of detections to return (Default is 10,000)

actions.description: Action handler for the on poll ingest functionality
actions.verbose: The action will ingest all of the 3rd party security alerts tracked within the enterprise and domain IoCs matches discovered within the enterprise as per the selected ingestion run mode.
